SEARCH
Package es.ulpgc.eii.spool.crawler.strategy

Class StreamCrawlerStrategy.StreamBuilder<R,T extends Event>

java.lang.Object
es.ulpgc.eii.spool.crawler.strategy.StreamCrawlerStrategy.StreamBuilder<R,T>
Type Parameters:
R - the type of raw payload produced by the source
T - the target Event type
Enclosing interface:
StreamCrawlerStrategy<T extends Event>
public static class StreamCrawlerStrategy.StreamBuilder<R,T extends Event> extends Object
Final builder step that assembles the StreamCrawlerStrategy with optional event and error callbacks.

Defaults:

  • onEvent — no-op; events are buffered silently.
  • onError — wraps the exception in a RuntimeException and rethrows it.

  • Method Details

    • onEvent

      public StreamCrawlerStrategy.StreamBuilder<R,T> onEvent(Consumer<T> onEvent)
      Registers a callback invoked immediately after each event is deserialized and added to the buffer.

      Useful for real-time side effects such as logging, metrics, or triggering downstream notifications without waiting for the next CrawlerStrategy.crawl() cycle.

      Parameters:
      onEvent - a non-null Consumer receiving each typed event
      Returns:
      this builder, for chaining

    • onError

      public StreamCrawlerStrategy.StreamBuilder<R,T> onError(Consumer<Exception> onError)
      Registers a callback invoked whenever an error occurs during message reception or deserialization.

      Overrides the default behaviour of rethrowing the error as a RuntimeException. A common alternative is to log the error and continue processing subsequent messages.

      Parameters:
      onError - a non-null Consumer receiving the exception
      Returns:
      this builder, for chaining

    • build

      public StreamCrawlerStrategy<T> build()
      Builds and returns a fully configured StreamCrawlerStrategy.

      The returned strategy owns an internal EventBuffer that accumulates events from the moment StreamCrawlerStrategy.start() is called. Each CrawlerStrategy.crawl() call atomically drains that buffer.

      Returns:
      a ready-to-use StreamCrawlerStrategy<T>
